tit.e: Tosho-Chosonsei (town and village system in islands)
Tosho-Chosonsei (town and village system in islands)

sen.j: 島嶼町村制（とうしょちょうそんせい）とは、本土における町村制と別に、島嶼部で施行された制度の一般名称。
sen.e: Tosho-Chosonsei is a generic term used to refer to the system implemented in island areas apart from the town and village system implemented in Japan's mainland.
Tosho-Chosonsei is a generic term used to refer to the system implemented in island areas apart from the town and village system implemented in Japan's mainland.

sen.j: 現在の、東京都伊豆諸島（青ヶ島村を除く）、島根県隠岐諸島、長崎県対馬、鹿児島県三島村・トカラ列島及び奄美群島、沖縄県で施行された。
sen.e: It was implemented in Izu Island chain of Tokyo (except for Aogashima Village), Oki Islands of Shimane Prefecture, Tsushima of Nagasaki Prefecture, Mishima-mura Village, Tokara Islands and Amami Islands of Kagoshima Prefecture, and Okinawa Prefecture.

It was implemented in the Izu Island chain of Tokyo (except for Aogashima Village), Oki Islands of Shimane Prefecture, Tsushima of Nagasaki Prefecture, Mishima-mura Village, Tokara Islands and Amami Islands of Kagoshima Prefecture, and Okinawa Prefecture.

tit.e: Before the town and village system
Before the town and village system
Before the town and village system

sen.j: 明治維新の後、新政府は旧来の地域区分を変更し、新たな中央集権国家の基盤作りに着手した。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, the new government altered the old regional partition in order to undertake establishment of the foundation for a new centralized government.
After the Meiji Restoration, the new government altered the old regional partition in order to undertake establishment of the foundation for a new centralized government.
After the Meiji Restoration, the new government altered the old regional partition in order to undertake establishment of the foundation for a new centralized government.

sen.j: それが廃藩置県であり、その下に置くものが、1871年（明治4年）制定翌年施行された大区小区制であった。
sen.e: This policy was called Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), under which daiku-shoku system (a centralized district system that abolished all pre-existing towns, villages and their offices and institutions) was established in 1871 and enforced the next year.

This policy was called Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), under which the daiku-shoku system (a centralized district system that abolished all pre-existing towns, villages and their offices and institutions) was established in 1871 and enforced the next year.

This policy was called Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures), under which the daiku-shoku system (a centralized district system that abolished all pre-existing towns, villages and their offices and institutions) was established in 1871 and enforced the next year.

sen.j: しかし、この制度は地域の特性を余りにも無視したため、失敗した。
sen.e: This system, however, ended in failure because it neglected regional characteristics to an inappropriate extent.
This system, however, ended in failure because it neglected regional characteristics to an inappropriate extent.
This system, however, ended in failure because it neglected regional characteristics to an inappropriate extent.

sen.j: 次に政府は、1878年(明治11年) に地方三新法を制定し、その内の郡区町村編制法により町村を置いた。
sen.e: Next the government established three new bills related to the local government system in 1878, and set towns and villages under one of those bills, Gunkuchoson henseiho (the Law for Reorganization of Counties, Wards, Towns and Villages).

Next the government established three new bills related to the local government system in 1878, and set towns and villages under one of those bills, Gunkuchoson henseiho (the Law for Reorganization of Counties, Wards, Towns and Villages).

Next the government established three new bills related to the local government system in 1878, and set towns and villages under one of those bills, Gunkuchoson henseiho (the Law for Reorganization of Counties, Wards, Towns and Villages).

sen.j: 後に、1888年（明治21年）の市制・町村制、1890年（明治23年）の府県制・郡制の制定により地方三新法は廃止された。
sen.e: Those new bills were abolished due to establishment of the city system and the town and village system in 1888 as well as to establishment of the prefecture system and the county system in 1890.
Those new bills were abolished due to establishment of the city system and the town and village system in 1888 as well as to establishment of the prefecture system and the county system in 1890.
Those new bills were abolished due to establishment of the city system and the town and village system in 1888 as well as to establishment of the prefecture system and the county system in 1890.

sen.j: 各島嶼部は、1888年（明治21年）の市制及び町村制施行から、1889年（明治22年）の勅令第1号により除外され、島庁が設置されたりした。
sen.e: Since establishment of the city system and the town and village system in 1888, island areas had been excluded from the system by the Imperial Edict No.1 of 1889, and had an island government established from time to time.
Island areas were excluded from the city system and the town and village system established in 1888 by the Imperial Edict No.1 of 1889, and had an Island Agency established from time to time.
sen.cmt: 「市制及び町村制施行から」の「から」は、sinceではなくfromの意ではないかと思われます。
sen.e: Island areas were excluded from the city system and the town and village system established in 1888 by the Imperial Edict No.1 of 1889, and had an Island Agency established from time to time.

sen.j: これは、本土町村とは異なり府県庁による直接統治であり、現在に当てはめれば東京都特別区が近い。
sen.e: Unlike towns and villages in Japan's mainland, this was a direct rule by the prefectural government, and resembles today's Tokyo Special Wards.

sen.j: また、一部は旧国名を存続使用していた。
sen.e: In addition, some areas continued to use their old provincial names.

sen.j: 以下は各島嶼の、当時の状況（名称は現在のもの）

tit.j: 東京都伊豆諸島及び小笠原諸島
tit.e: Izu Island chain and Ogasawara Islands, Tokyo
The Izu Island chain and Ogasawara Islands, Tokyo
The Izu Island chain and Ogasawara Islands, Tokyo

sen.j: 人口が少ないことや、小笠原諸島には欧米系住民の居住などもあり、東京府による直接の行政運営がなされ、町村の設置は大幅に遅れた。
sen.e: These islands were directly administered by Tokyo Prefecture because they had a small population and because people from Europe and America lived in Ogasawara Islands, and towns and villages were not set until much later.

sen.j: 特に小笠原の本土並の行政組織設置は、1968年（昭和43年）の本土復帰後である。
sen.e: Especially in the case of Ogasawara, it was after the return to the mainland in 1968 that the same public administration system as in the mainland was established.

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）足柄県が廃止され静岡県に編入。
sen.e: In 1876 Ashigara Prefecture was abolished and incorporated into Shizuoka Prefecture.
In 1876 Ashigara Prefecture was abolished and incorporated into Shizuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 1878年（明治11年）東京府に移管される。
sen.e: In 1878 it was transferred to Tokyo Prefecture.
In 1878 it was transferred to Tokyo Prefecture.
In 1878 it was transferred to Tokyo Prefecture.

sen.j: 1900年（明治33年）伊豆諸島に大島島庁、八丈島庁、小笠原諸島に小笠原島庁が設置された。
sen.e: In 1900 Oshima island government and Hachijo island government were established in Izu Island chain, and Ogasawara island government in Ogasawara Islands.
In 1900 the Oshima island government and Hachijo island government were established in the Izu Island chain, and the Ogasawara island government in Ogasawara Islands.

sen.j: 1923年（大正12年）伊豆諸島（青ヶ島を除く）で島嶼町村制施行。
sen.e: In 1923 Tosho-Chosonsei was established in Izu Island chain (except for Aogashima island).
In 1923 Tosho-Chosonsei was established in the Izu Island chain (except for the Aogashima island).
In 1923 Tosho-Chosonsei was established in the Izu Island chain (except for the Aogashima island).

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年）島庁廃止にともなって、支庁に改組。
sen.e: In 1926 the island governments were abolished and reorganized into subprefectures.
In 1926 the island governments were abolished and reorganized into subprefectures.
In 1926 the island governments were abolished and reorganized into subprefectures.

sen.j: 1940年（昭和15年）伊豆諸島の島嶼町村制が普通町村制に移行、同時に青ヶ島に普通町村制による青ヶ島村を設置。
sen.e: In 1940 Tosho-Chosonsei in Izu Island chain was shifted to the regular town and village system, and Aogashima Village was established in Aogashima island under the regular town and village system at the same time.

sen.j: 小笠原諸島でも普通町村制を施行。
sen.e: The regular town and village system was implemented in Ogasawara Islands, too.
The regular town and village system was implemented in Ogasawara Islands, too.
The regular town and village system was implemented in Ogasawara Islands, too.

sen.j: 1946年（昭和21年）小笠原諸島が、アメリカ軍の直接統治の下におかれる。
sen.e: In 1946 Ogasawara Islands were put under direct rule by the U.S. Forces.
In 1946 Ogasawara Islands were put under direct rule by the U.S. Forces.
In 1946 Ogasawara Islands were put under direct rule by the U.S. Forces.

sen.j: 1952年（昭和27年）サンフランシスコ講和条約により、小笠原諸島6村は日本政府の行政から分離され廃止、アメリカの信託統治領となり引き続きアメリカ軍管理下に置かれる。
sen.e: In 1952, due to the Peace Treaty signed in San Francisco, six villages in Ogasawara Islands were removed from the public administration of the Japan government, abolished, designated as Trust Territory governed by the United States of America and remained under the rule by the U.S. Forces.

In 1952, due to the Peace Treaty signed in San Francisco, six villages in Ogasawara Islands were removed from the public administration of the Japanese government, abolished, put under an American trusteeship and remained under the rule of the U.S. Forces.

In 1952, due to the Peace Treaty signed in San Francisco, six villages in Ogasawara Islands were removed from the public administration of the Japanese government, abolished, put under an American trusteeship and remained under the rule of the U.S. Forces.

sen.j: 1968年（昭和43年）アメリカ軍から返還、復帰すると同時に小笠原支庁の全村が合併し、小笠原村となる。
sen.e: When they were returned to Japan's mainland by the U.S. Forces in 1968, all the villages within Ogasawara Subprefecture were merged into Ogasawara Village.

sen.j: 隠岐諸島では当初、海士、知夫、周吉、穏地の4郡が設置され、郡役所による行政が行われていた。
sen.e: At first four counties (Ama, Chibu, Suki and Ochi Counties) were established in Oki Islands and they were governed by the respective county office.
At first four counties (Ama, Chibu, Suki and Ochi Counties) were established in Oki Islands and they were governed by the respective county offices.
At first four counties (Ama, Chibu, Suki and Ochi Counties) were established in Oki Islands and they were governed by the respective county offices.

sen.j: しかし、1889年の島嶼指定により島根県は4郡を廃止して隠岐島庁を設置、「島司」が行政に当たった。
sen.e: At the time of designation as tosho (islands) in 1889, Shimane Prefecture abolished the four counties and established Oki island government, and "Toshi" (governor of the island government) took charge of public administration.

However, at the time of designation as tosho (islands) in 1889, Shimane Prefecture abolished the four counties and established the Oki island government, and "Toshi" (governor of the island government) took charge of public administration.

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）隠岐国に隠岐県を設置した後、大森県に編入。
sen.e: In 1869, Oki Prefecture was established in Oki Province and then incorporated into Omori Prefecture.
In 1869, Oki Prefecture was established in Oki Province and then incorporated into Omori Prefecture.
In 1869, Oki Prefecture was established in Oki Province and then incorporated into Omori Prefecture.

sen.j: その後、島根県と鳥取県のどちらに編入するか、定まらなかった。
sen.e: After that, it was not decided for a while whether Oki Islands should be incorporated into Shimane Prefecture or Tottori Prefecture.
After that, it had not been decided for a while whether Oki Islands should be incorporated into Shimane Prefecture or Tottori Prefecture.
After that, it had not been decided for a while whether Oki Islands should be incorporated into Shimane Prefecture or Tottori Prefecture.

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）現在まで続く島根県所属が決定した。
sen.e: In 1876 it was decided that they should be incorporated into Shimane Prefecture (and they still belong there).
In 1876 it was decided that they should be incorporated into Shimane Prefecture (and they still belong there).
In 1876 it was decided that they should be incorporated into Shimane Prefecture (and they still belong there).

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）隠岐諸島4郡を廃止、隠岐島庁が設置された。
sen.e: In 1889 four counties in Oki Islands were abolished and Oki island government was established.
In 1889 four counties in Oki Islands were abolished and the Oki island government was established.
In 1889 four counties in Oki Islands were abolished and the Oki island government was established.

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）島嶼指定が解除され、「本土並み」の町村制が施行され4郡復活。
sen.e: In 1904 the designation as tosho was eliminated, a town and village system was implemented "in the same manners as in the mainland" and four counties were restored.
In 1904 the designation as tosho was eliminated, a town and village system was implemented "in the same manners as in the mainland" and four counties were restored.
In 1904 the designation as tosho was eliminated, a town and village system was implemented "in the same manners as in the mainland" and four counties were restored.

sen.j: 島庁（島司）の権限は本土の郡役所（郡長）のそれに変更された。
sen.e: The authority of the island government (or Toshi) was changed into that of the county office (or the governor of the county) in the mainland.
The authority of the island government (or Toshi) was changed into that of the county office (or the governor of the county) in the mainland.
The authority of the island government (or Toshi) was changed into that of the county office (or the governor of the county) in the mainland.

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）隠岐島庁が廃止され、島根県隠岐支庁が設置された。
sen.e: In 1925 Oki island government was abolished and Oki Subprefecture of Shimane Prefecture was established.
In 1925 the Oki island government was abolished and Oki Subprefecture of Shimane Prefecture was established.
In 1925 the Oki island government was abolished and Oki Subprefecture of Shimane Prefecture was established.

sen.j: 1969年（昭和44年）4郡が合併し、現在の隠岐郡となった。
sen.e: In 1969 four counties were merged into the present Oki County.
In 1969 four counties were merged into the present Oki County.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）現在の対馬市の領域に、14箇村が設置される。
sen.e: In 1889 fourteen villages were established in the area of today's Tsushima City.

tit.j: 鹿児島県三島村・トカラ列島及び奄美群島

sen.j: 奄美諸島では鹿児島県設置後も、西南戦争で荒廃した県本土の復興資金調達のため、県の直接統治が政府により承認されていた。
sen.e: In Amami Islands, the government approved of the direct rule by the prefecture even after the establishment of Kagoshima Prefecture, in order to raise fund for restoration of the mainland Kagoshima, which had been ruined by the Seinan War.

The government approved of the direct rule of the prefecture over Amami Islands even after the establishment of Kagoshima Prefecture, in order to raise fund for restoration of Kagoshima's mainland, which had been ruined by the Seinan War.

sen.j: また、支庁（後、島庁）の下位行政区画は、琉球王国以来の間切制を採用していたが、一部は郡区町村編制法施行時に、村に名称を変更した。

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）郡区町村編制法施行に伴い、奄美諸島を大島郡として大隅国に編入し、郡役所を金久村に設置、鹿児島県大隅国大島郡と呼称された。
sen.e: In 1879, with the enforcement of Gunkuchoson henseiho, Amami Islands, as Oshima County, were incorporated in Osumi Province and named Oshima County, Osumi Province, Kagoshima Prefecture, with its county office established in Kaneku Village.

sen.j: 1885年（明治18年）郡役所を廃止して金久支庁を開設。

sen.j: 1886年（明治19年）金久支庁を大島島庁と改称し、支庁長を島司とした。

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年）郡制の廃止に伴い、島庁は支庁に改称され、島司は支庁長とされた。
sen.e: In 1926, with the abolishment of the county system, the island government was renamed Subprefecture, and Toshi became the governor of Subprefecture.

In 1973 Mishima Village and Toshima Village, Oshima County were transferred to Kagoshima Prefecture.
In 1973 Mishima Village and Toshima Village, Oshima County were transferred to Kagoshima Prefecture.

sen.j: 明治の時代になっても、沖縄県では法整備が遅れ、旧琉球王国以来の体制が継続した。
sen.e: Even in the Meiji period, legal systems were not developed in Okinawa Prefecture and the old systems which had been used since the age of the Ryukyu Kingdom were still in effect.
Even in the Meiji period, legal systems were not developed in Okinawa Prefecture and the old systems which had been used since the age of the Ryukyu Kingdom were still in effect.
Even in the Meiji period, legal systems were not developed in Okinawa Prefecture and the old systems which had been used since the age of the Ryukyu Kingdom were still in effect.

sen.j: そして、現在の町村に当たるものとして、間切制を採用していた。
sen.e: Magiri system was adopted instead of today's towns and villages.
The Magiri system was adopted instead of today's towns and villages.
The Magiri system was adopted instead of today's towns and villages.

sen.j: しかし、本土に比べ住民に負担の多い制度が多々存続したため、沖縄県各地で旧制度廃止・改善を要求する運動が起こり、政府は漸次本土並の制度を施行して行った。
sen.e: However, because of many remaining systems which placed a heavier burden on the residents than in the mainland, people campained for abolishment or improvement of the old systems in various areas in Okinawa, and the government gradually implemented the same systems as in the mainland.

However, because of many remaining systems which placed a heavier burden on the residents than in the mainland, people campaigned for the abolishment or improvement of the old systems in various areas in Okinawa, and the government gradually implemented the same systems as in the mainland.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを直し、冠詞を補いました。
sen.e: However, because of many remaining systems which placed a heavier burden on the residents than in the mainland, people campaigned for the abolishment or improvement of the old systems in various areas in Okinawa, and the government gradually implemented the same systems as in the mainland.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）明治政府は全国で廃藩置県を実施。
sen.e: In 1871 the Meiji government implemented Haihan-chiken throughout Japan.
In 1871 the Meiji government implemented Haihan-chiken throughout Japan.
In 1871 the Meiji government implemented Haihan-chiken throughout Japan.

sen.j: 1872年（明治5年）琉球王国を廃止して琉球藩を設置。
sen.e: In 1872 the Ryukyu Kingdom was abolished and Ryukyu Domain was established.
In 1872 the Ryukyu Kingdom was abolished and Ryukyu Domain was established.
In 1872 the Ryukyu Kingdom was abolished and Ryukyu Domain was established.

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）琉球藩を廃止して沖縄県を設置した。
sen.e: In 1879 Ryukyu Domain was abolished and Okinawa Prefecture was established.
In 1879 Ryukyu Domain was abolished and Okinawa Prefecture was established.
In 1879 Ryukyu Domain was abolished and Okinawa Prefecture was established.

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）明治29年勅令第13号「沖縄県ノ郡編制ニ関スル件」により、島尻郡、中頭郡、国頭郡、宮古郡、八重山郡の五郡を設置し、宮古と八重山に島庁（島司）を置いた。
sen.e: In 1896, with the Imperial Edict No.13 of 1896 "Edict concerning organization of counties in Okinawa Prefecture," five counties (Shimajiri, Nakagami, Kunigami and Miyako Counties) were created and island governments (Toshi) were established in Miyako and Yaeyama.

In 1896, with the Imperial Edict No.13 of 1896 "Edict concerning organization of counties in Okinawa Prefecture," five counties (Shimajiri, Nakagami, Kunigami, Miyako and Yaeyama Counties) were created and island governments (Toshi) were established in Miyako and Yaeyama.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ部（八重山郡）を補いました。
sen.e: In 1896, with the Imperial Edict No.13 of 1896 "Edict concerning organization of counties in Okinawa Prefecture," five counties (Shimajiri, Nakagami, Kunigami, Miyako and Yaeyama Counties) were created and island governments (Toshi) were established in Miyako and Yaeyama.

sen.j: また、「那覇市」の前身「那覇区」と首里の前身「首里区」を設置。
sen.e: Furthermore, "Naha Ward," the predecessor of "Naha City," and "Shuri Ward," the predecessor of Shuri, were created.
Furthermore, "Naha Ward," the predecessor of "Naha City," and "Shuri Ward," the predecessor of Shuri, were created.
Furthermore, "Naha Ward," the predecessor of "Naha City," and "Shuri Ward," the predecessor of Shuri, were created.

sen.j: 1908年（明治41年）島嶼町村制が施行され、間切が廃止される。
sen.e: In 1908 Taosho-Chosonsei was enforced and Magiri system was abolished.
In 1908 Taosho-Chosonsei was enforced and the Magiri system was abolished.
In 1908 Taosho-Chosonsei was enforced and the Magiri system was abolished.

sen.j: 1920年（大正9年）島嶼指定が解除され、「本土並み」の町村制が施行された。
sen.e: In 1920 the designation as tosho was eliminated and a town and village system was implemented "in the same manners as in the mainland."
In 1920 the designation as tosho was eliminated and a town and village system was implemented "in the same manners as in the mainland."
In 1920 the designation as tosho was eliminated and a town and village system was implemented "in the same manners as in the mainland."

sen.j: また、島庁（島司）の権限は本土の郡役所（郡長）のそれに変更された。
sen.e: In addition, the authority of the island governments (or Toshi) was changed into that of the county office (or the governor of the county) in the mainland.
In addition, the authority of the island governments (or Toshi) was changed into that of the county office (or the governor of the county) in the mainland.
In addition, the authority of the island governments (or Toshi) was changed into that of the county office (or the governor of the county) in the mainland.

sen.j: 1921年（大正10年）「那覇市」設立（特別区制が廃止され、一般市制の施行による）。
sen.e: In 1921 "Naha City" was created (as a result of abolishment of the special ward system and enforcement of the regular municipal organization).
In 1921 "Naha City" was created (as a result of abolishment of the special ward system and enforcement of the regular municipal organization).
In 1921 "Naha City" was created (as a result of abolishment of the special ward system and enforcement of the regular municipal organization).

sen.j: 明治22年勅令第1号、町村制ヲ施行セサル島嶼指定ノ件。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.1 of 1889 "Edict concerning designation of tosho for which the town and village system shall not be enforced."
The Imperial Edict No.1 of 1889 "Edict concerning designation of tosho for which the town and village system shall not be enforced."
The Imperial Edict No.1 of 1889 "Edict concerning designation of tosho for which the town and village system shall not be enforced."

sen.j: 明治29年勅令第13号、沖縄県ノ郡編制ニ関スル件。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.13 of 1896 "Edict concerning organization of counties in Okinawa Prefecture."
The Imperial Edict No.13 of 1896 "Edict concerning organization of counties in Okinawa Prefecture."
The Imperial Edict No.13 of 1896 "Edict concerning organization of counties in Okinawa Prefecture."

sen.j: 明治32年勅令第228号、島嶼ニ関スル府県行政ノ特例ニ関スル件。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.228 of 1899 "Edict concerning special exceptions of public administration of prefectures in connection with tosho"
The Imperial Edict No.228 of 1899 "Edict concerning special exceptions of public administration of prefectures in connection with tosho"
The Imperial Edict No.228 of 1899 "Edict concerning special exceptions of public administration of prefectures in connection with tosho"

sen.j: 明治37年勅令第63号、島根県隠岐国ニ於ケル町村制度ニ関スル件。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.63 of 1904 "Edict concerning the town and village system in Oki Province, Shimane Prefecture."
The Imperial Edict No.63 of 1904 "Edict concerning the town and village system in Oki Province, Shimane Prefecture."
The Imperial Edict No.63 of 1904 "Edict concerning the town and village system in Oki Province, Shimane Prefecture."

sen.j: 明治40年勅令第45号、沖縄県間切島並東京府伊豆七島及小笠原島ニ於ケル名称及区域ノ変更等ニ関スル件。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.45 of 1907 "Edict concerning the change of names and partitions in Magiri Island, Okinawa Prefecture as well as in Izu Seven Islands and Ogasawara Islands, Tokyo Prefecture."
The Imperial Edict No.45 of 1907 "Edict concerning the change of names and partitions in Magiri Island, Okinawa Prefecture as well as in Izu Seven Islands and Ogasawara Islands, Tokyo Prefecture."
The Imperial Edict No.45 of 1907 "Edict concerning the change of names and partitions in Magiri Island, Okinawa Prefecture as well as in Izu Seven Islands and Ogasawara Islands, Tokyo Prefecture."

sen.j: 同年勅令第46号、沖縄県及島嶼町村制。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.46 of 1907 "Edict concerning Okinawa Prefecture and Tosho-Chosonsei."
The Imperial Edict No.46 of 1907 "Edict concerning Okinawa Prefecture and Tosho-Chosonsei."

sen.j: 明治41年勅令第43号、沖縄県区制。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.43 of 1908 "Edict concerning the ward system in Okinawa Prefecture."
The Imperial Edict No.43 of 1908 "Edict concerning the ward system in Okinawa Prefecture."

sen.j: 明治42年勅令第20号、沖縄県ニ関スル府県制特例ノ件。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.20 of 1909 "Edict concerning special exceptions of the prefecture system in connection with Okinawa Prefecture."
The Imperial Edict No.20 of 1909 "Edict concerning special exceptions of the prefecture system in connection with Okinawa Prefecture."

sen.j: 同年勅令第31号、勅令中沖縄県ニ付設ケタル特例ニ関スル件。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.31 of 1909 "Edict concerning special exceptions made for Okinawa Prefecture in the imperial edicts."
The Imperial Edict No.31 of 1909 "Edict concerning special exceptions made for Okinawa Prefecture in the imperial edicts."

sen.j: 同年勅令第54号、島庁ヲ置ク島地指定ノ件。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.54 of 1909 "Edict concerning designation of islands on which island governments should be established."
The Imperial Edict No.54 of 1909 "Edict concerning designation of islands on which island governments should be established."

sen.j: 大正7年勅令第335号、長崎県対馬国島根県隠岐国ニ於ケル町村制度ニ関スル件。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.335 of 1918 "Edict concerning the town and village system in Tsushima Province, Nagasaki Prefecture and Oki Province, Shimane Prefecture."

sen.j: 大正10年勅令第190号、町村制ヲ施行セサル島嶼指定ノ件。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.190 of 1921 "Edict concerning designation of tosho for which the town and village system shall not be enforced."

sen.j: 昭和18年勅令第446号、町村制ヲ施行セザル島嶼指定ノ件。
sen.e: The Imperial Edict No.446 of 1943 "Edict concerning designation of tosho for which the town and village system shall not be enforced."
